intro: Schwantesia loeschiana, commonly known as the Schwalbenschwan, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are often pink or red, and they bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
